function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Deviation from the norm and isomorphism may lead to a lack of adaptation to disruptions like pandemics.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Contagious diseases propagation due to crowded indoor environments such as casinos","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Normative pressure leading to potential neglect of health and safety regulations","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Mimicking of social norms leading to potential disregard for health and safety measures","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Disease transmission in the built environment due to social interactions and legitimacy-seeking activities","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Studies under the functionalist school focused on rational efforts of managers to maximize efficiency through the coordination and control of work activities.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Shift toward studying contingency variables such as environmental uncertainty, and determining their effect on structure.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Bounded rationality studies suggesting that managers are boundedly rational, and decision making entails a satisficing rather than an optimizing approach.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Power dependence theory and institutional theory providing a supplemental and different viewpoint for conceptualizing organizations.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Impact of covid-19 on service firms and customer interaction","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Resistance to adopting new practices such as e-consulting for haircuts","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Difficulty achieving theorization in all service sectors","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited ability for service firms to affect customer demand during a pandemic","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate adaptation to covid-19 disruptions in the service industry","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of social legitimacy and acceptance of adaptive strategies","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Close physical interaction in service industries increases the risk of contagious diseases propagation.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of adherence to new regulations wearing masks in public leading to increased spread of the disease.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Severe loss of demand and revenues in non-essential services such as entertainment and tourism.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited access to financial aid and resources for smes, especially in skill development and training.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Ineffective economic interventions","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Ineffective public health policies","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Restructuring the team based on medical project requirements","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Prolonged discussions with doctors","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential spread of contagious diseases through close individual interactions within service smes.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Relocation decisions based on anticipated access requirements of customers may increase the risk of disease spread.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of agility and adaptability in coping with crisis times may lead to increased vulnerability to contagious disease outbreaks.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Having informal close relationships and provision of reaching them for overcoming potential future financial constraints","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Service smes’ relationship building and process-enabling capabilities are critical for survival and sustainability in disruptive service conditions.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Strategic sensitivity is a critical capability for service smes, particularly in anticipation and understanding of pandemic and post-pandemic conditions.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Flexibility in reshaping businesses and empowering other parties to shape the nature or process of service provision is essential for service smes.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Forced closures of service businesses","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High demand for certain services beyond capacity","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased risk of contagion due to social isolation and increased indoor activities like cooking and baking together with children.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inefficient diagnostic procedures and increased pressure on health-care services.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Mutual interaction becoming more vital during the pandemic period","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Psychological burden due to negative experiences during the pandemic","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Uncertainty and worry among actors in the service ecosystem","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Encouraging physical activities for children using basic household items may increase the risk of spreading contagious diseases if proper hygiene and sanitation measures are not followed","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Idle employees in the real estate business during the pandemic may lead to increased risk of viral transmission if proper safety measures are not followed","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of synchronization in service processes between partners may lead to miscommunication and an increased risk of inefficiency, potentially impacting the delivery of services and public health","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased consumption of unhealthy food due to lifestyle changes during the pandemic.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of access to safe and healthy food options.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Open access classes for children may increase the risk of contagion in the community.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Continuing indoor activities without appropriate safety measures may lead to a higher risk of contagion.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of ethical interaction capability in service smes","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Nonopportunistic processes between actors in smes","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Close interaction and co-creation may lead to increased risk of contagious diseases transmission.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of customer needs identification","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited access to financial support during covid-19","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reliance on personal networks for financial support","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"}]}
